title: Ticket #1563: VMuniverse doesn't work if there is a space in the filename
description: A customer reports that VMuniverse with vmware doesn't work if there is a space in the filename of the .vmx file, but it worked in 7.4.x.
remarks:
2010-Aug-06 11:44:59 by jfrey:
This was caused by the use of a StringList in condor_submit with the default delimiters (space and comma) when parsing a list of files. The only delimiter should be comma. I found two other locations in condor_submit with the same problem.

2010-Aug-06 11:48:16 by jfrey:
Pushed a fix to master for 7.5.4.

2010-Aug-06 11:50:11 by jfrey:
The vm universe bug was introduced by #1351 in Condor 7.5.3.
check_ins: 2010-Aug-06 11:47   Check-in [18741]: Fix parsing of file lists containing spaces in condor_submit #1563 In several places in condor_submit, we were parsing a list of filenames using StringList with the default delimiters (space and comma). Thus, if a filename contains a space, it gets broken into two names. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: gthain
